> 
> I looked at the pictures for a long while, and tried to imagine the 
tsuba being mounted and in an oncoming position as if it was mounted 
and worn.
> 
> To my eye it looks more natural if mounted on a tachi with the ha 
pointing down.
> 
> If mounted on a katana the sukashi is hidden against the clothing 
and body and just does not seem right.
> 
> I think it would work either way however, just looks better mounted 
as a tachi.
> 
> John
>

John und all,
May be your perception is prejudiced by the 4 mon Jim posted.
If in deed the wisteria motif represent a mon on that tsuba, there 
are many mon with the wisteria hanging down the natural way.
From the big mon book Tom bought for me while he's in Japan, I 
counted over 20 mon with wisteria hanging down.
I sent the illustrations to Jim, may be Jim can post some of those 
onto the list album ( the scans I sent are not of the higest 
quality )?

Milt
